page.title: 17Local History
page.content:
The Battle of Dupplin Moor was fought to the north of Forteviot, beside Bankhead Farm, in 1732. John Balliol and his army encamped in the Miller's Acre just to the east of the present school. Balliol led the English Army against the over confident Scots at night, crossing the ford to the north west of the village. 3000 were killed.
Kenneth son of Alpin, the first ruler of the combined kingdom of the Scots and Picts, died in the royal hall at Forteviot.A large stone arch was found in the River May and is supposed to come from the royal chapel of the Pictish times. Aerial photographs highlight burial, and ritual or ceremonial sites, possibly as early as 2000 B.C.
